page.title: 10HOUSES OLD AND NEW
page.content: Houses built this century consist of grid-like roads lined with terraces.These have rounded or square bays,slate roofs or tiles,red-brick walls,small forecourt,neat back garden conservatory.There is some new sheltered housing for the old. On the new housing estate, Anchorage Park,houses are grouped in threes and fours ,with narrow windows and front gardens without fences.Interviews with residents reveal a liking for the quiet environment,easy access out of town (The Eastern Road connects with the motorway),bigger gardens,and comfort.Disadvantages include only one bus service,necessity of owning a car,few facilities (just one community centre and pub),one post box,no shops,and isolation.A new hypermarket opens in 1986.
